intro: Anemone globosa, commonly known as the globeflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive spherical flower heads, which are composed of numerous small, white to pinkish petals. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained, rocky soils. Its leaves are palmately divided, with a rough, hairy texture that helps reduce water loss. Anemone globosa is known for its early spring blooming, often appearing before the leaves fully develop.
